title: CSM Târgu Mureș (football)
text:
Clubul Sportiv Municipal Târgu Mureș, commonly known as CSM Târgu Mureș, or simply Târgu Mureș, is a Romanian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="T%C3%A2rgu%20Mure%C8%99">Târgu Mureș</a>, <a href="Mure%C8%99%20County">Mureș County</a>.
The team was founded in the summer of 2018 as the football section of <a href="CSM%20T%C3%A2rgu%20Mure%C8%99">CSM Târgu Mureș</a>.
History.
<a href="T%C3%A2rgu%20Mure%C8%99">Târgu Mureș</a>' football history began in 1944 with <a href="CS%20T%C3%A2rgu%20Mure%C8%99">CS Târgu Mureș</a> and continued with <a href="ASA%20T%C3%A2rgu%20Mure%C8%99%20%281962%29">ASA Târgu Mureș (1962)</a> and <a href="ASA%202013%20T%C3%A2rgu%20Mure%C8%99">ASA 2013 Târgu Mureș</a>. All three teams played multiple seasons in the <a href="Liga%20I">Liga I</a>; their best results are finishing as runners-up in the first league (ASA 1962 in the <a href="1974%E2%80%9375%20Divizia%20A">1974–75 season</a> and ASA 2013 in the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Liga%20I">2014–15 season</a>).
CSM Târgu Mureș was founded in the summer of 2018 as the football section of <a href="CSM%20T%C3%A2rgu%20Mure%C8%99">CSM Târgu Mureș</a>, a <a href="Sports%20club">multi-sport</a> club established on 19 December 2017, following the bankruptcy of ASA 2013 Târgu Mureș.
Ground.
The club plays its home matches at <a href="Stadionul%20Trans-Sil">Trans-Sil Stadium</a> in <a href="T%C3%A2rgu%20Mure%C8%99">Târgu Mureș</a>, with a capacity of 8,200 seats.
Honours.
<a href="Liga%20IV%20Mure%C8%99">Liga IV – Mureș County</a>
